medical_history.chief_complaint: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) with symptoms including dyspnea, angina, and presyncope.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms manifested progressively, with initial diagnoses often made during evaluations for murmurs in childhood or adolescence. Symptoms such as dyspnea and presyncope developed over time, with some patients becoming symptomatic within a couple of years post-diagnosis. Factors aggravating symptoms included physical exertion and outflow obstruction.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy diagnosed in multiple patients within the evaluated cohort; some patients required surgical interventions (myectomy or transplant) due to severe manifestations. Notable history of syncope, cardiac murmurs, and obstructive HCM were prevalent.
medical_history.family_history: Three patients had positive family histories of sudden cardiac death (SCD), and one patient had a notable family history of HCM including deceased relatives who suffered from SCD at young ages.
